title: Zelensky Brings Backup to the White House as Trump Aligns More Closely With Putin
content: European leaders are joining a trip to Washington to make sure the trans-Atlantic alliance remains intact.

title: Pence Welcomes Trump’s D.C. Deployment of the National Guard
content: Former Vice President Mike Pence said he wished President Trump “would have done more” on Jan. 6, but supported the recent decision to deploy troops to Washington.

title: Trump Officials Hint at Possible Concessions by Putin
content: Secretary of State Marco Rubio and Steve Witkoff, an envoy for President Trump, suggested that a peace deal was still distant.

title: Trump and Putin Find Common Ground on One Issue: Biden
content: The Alaska summit between the U.S. and Russian leaders showcased their mutual animosity for the former president.

title: Trump Administration Minimizes Summit Papers Left in Hotel
content: The papers, laying out the sequence of events and including the phone numbers of several officials, were found around 9 a.m. on Friday and sent to NPR by a guest of the hotel.

title: Brighty the Burro, Beloved Grand Canyon Statue, Is Rescued From Dragon Bravo Fire
content: The statue was missing an ear and two front legs, but it was mostly intact when crews recovered it from the Dragon Bravo fire.

title: European Leaders to Join Zelensky for Meeting With Trump
content: After the Trump-Putin summit, European leaders said they would accompany President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine to the White House on Monday.

title: Trump’s Selective Stance on Justice: Redemption for Some, Scorn for Others
content: President Trump, himself a felon, has shown particular leniency to criminals he seems to identify with — people who are white or wealthy, or who rioted in his name on Jan. 6, 2021.

title: Redistricting Push Would Further Divide a Polarized Congress
content: Many state delegations are already under single-party control. New maps could tighten the partisan grip while decreasing the importance of general elections.

title: Wildfire Fighters, Unmasked in Toxic Smoke, Are Getting Sick and Dying
content: The U.S. Forest Service has fought decades of efforts to better protect its crews — sending them into smoke without masks or warnings about the risks.

title: North Carolina Confederate Monument Goes Too Far, Lawsuit Says
content: A long battle over the pro-slavery words on a Tyrrell County statue intensifies as the Trump administration reclaims Confederate imagery.

title: For a Few Hours, a Party Drowns Out the Tensions in D.C.
content: At Fort Dupont Park, thousands gathered to honor a local music legend, creating a brief refuge from the conflict.

title: Protesters Against National Guard Deployment Flood D.C. Streets
content: A largely peaceful march filled downtown Washington with chants and whistles.

title: U.S. Pauses Visitor Visas for Gazans After Laura Loomer Posts
content: The move blocked a pathway for those seeking medical care in the United States, including young children, who have arrived in recent weeks with serious conditions.

title: Hiker in Tennessee Who Picked Up a Venomous Snake Dies After Being Bitten
content: While thousands of people are bitten by venomous snakes in the United States each year, deaths are uncommon, according to the authorities.

title: Protesters Gather to Oppose Trump’s Push on Redistricting
content: Thousands assembled around the country to demonstrate against a Republican effort to redraw congressional maps in their favor for 2026.

title: Louisiana Has a Long History of Political Corruption
content: For decades, Louisiana lawmakers at all levels of government have been caught up in corruption allegations.

title: Jeanine Pirro Takes on Prosecutor Role in Trump’s D.C. Crackdown
content: As the U.S. attorney in Washington, Jeanine Pirro is a central player in a clash that could define her legacy: the president’s takeover of local law enforcement.

title: Trump Bows to Putin’s Approach on Ukraine: No Cease-Fire, Deadlines or Sanctions
content: The net effect of the Alaska summit was to give President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia a free pass to continue his war against his neighbor indefinitely without further penalty, pending talks on a broader peace deal.

title: 3 Republican-Led States to Send National Guard Troops to D.C.
content: Gov. Patrick Morrisey of West Virginia said his state would send 300 to 400 troops to Washington, while Gov. Henry McMaster of South Carolina pledged 200 members. Gov. Mike DeWine said he would send another 150.

title: National Guard says members patrolling D.C. 'may be armed'
content: National Guard members and federal law enforcement officers are patrolling the city as part of President Trump's effort to assert federal control over policing in the District.

title: Air Canada suspends restart plans after union defies return to work order
content: Air Canada will resume flights Monday evening, claiming the union illegally directed flight attendants to defy a return-to-work order.

title: After meeting Putin, Trump changes his position on the need for a ceasefire
content: When President Trump was flying to Alaska to meet Vladimir Putin, he said the goal was a ceasefire. But after they talked, Trump aligned himself with Putin and downplayed the need for a truce.

title: One neurosurgeon, 8 million patients
content: Alieu Kamara is the first and only neurosurgeon in Sierra Leone. "Before Dr. Kamara, there was no hope," said professor Kehinde Oluwadiya of the University of Sierra Leone Teaching Hospital Complex.

title: Hurricane Erin downgraded to Category 3 storm

title: European leaders to join Ukraine's Zelenskyy for White House meeting with Trump

title: Washington's hydropower has created a data center boom. Some are concerned about its future.
content: In small town Washington — where hydropower is plentiful — data centers are creating jobs and funding amenities. But water and energy aren't unlimited — and some worry about long-term sustainability.

title: Three Republican-led states to send hundreds of National Guard troops to Washington
